dragon new warm mountain i believe in
you it's a brand new album from indie
folk and indie rock outfit big thief
their fifth to date if i remember
correctly and it's been a minute since
we've heard from the band like many
groups on the indie circuit during the
pandemic big thief pretty much laid low
during much of that time who could blame
them without the ability to tour on top
of that they kind of spoiled fans in
2019 with two records released in that
year the second of which left a far more
positive impression on me than the first
front woman adrian lanker also dropped
two sister solo albums in the year 2020
that were pretty great james and buck
members of the band also kept pretty
busy with their own solo material too
but now they're back in big thief mode
obviously and it seems they wanted to
make a big return with 20 whole new
tracks on this record which i was kind
of hesitant going into because i i do
like big thief but do
i 80 minutes like big thief
plus albums of this size tend to be
super thematic and conceptual and
there's a whole series of risk factors
that come into play with that but in a
way i was refreshed to find that dragon
new warm mountain is a double album that
feels almost half its length the
record's actually kind of fun and maybe
even a little easy to listen to as end
to end it's packed with all these punchy
and direct blends of indie folk folk
rock art country with a few
semi-psychedelic experiments in the mix
too in many ways i think this lp takes
off from where big thief left us on
their two hands record
but kind of dives into that direction as
boldly as they possibly can this lp also
strikes a really good balance between
consistency and variety featuring some
of big thief's best songs to date too
like spud infinity red moon and blue
lightning all of which are really wild
backwater country and folk with lots of
colorful backing instrumentation linkers
vocals provide a smart and kind of
eccentric twang to the whole thing
meanwhile songs like simulation swarm
the only place in certainty feel a lot
more modern pulling from some classic
indie folk acts such as elliott smith
modest mouse bonnie prince billy
especially in the rhythm section and
guitar work not to mention 12 000 lines
is just about the best joni mitchell
warship i've heard in a minute for
simplicity's sake we also have some very
stripped back acoustic cuts that could
have fit on linker's last couple of solo
records dried roses promises a pendulum
of course on these tracks linker's
vocals and unique lyricism shine like
the communication and emotional blocks
on promise being likened to hearing
fantastically quiet things or
impossibly building these natural
wonders such as rainbows or a meteor
shower these pockets of the record
contrast nicely of course with moments
where they're diving into some really
rich sonic experimentation like time
escaping for example the quirky
arpeggios and lo-fi beet loops on this
one create a total groove gasm which
gives way to these heavenly rushes of
vocal harmonies and flower of blood is a
pretty effective combination of indie
folk aesthetics and hazy 90s shoe gaze
in my opinion meanwhile the subtle and
dusty lo-fi drums and eerie ringing keys
and guitars on blurred view really crawl
into your brain stem along with adrian's
vocals being so close they're almost
asmr and i have to mention wake me up to
drive
the
peppy casio drum machine beats on this
one along with the accordion sound like
the result of some kind of random
instrument generator but big thief
somehow makes it work sounding like one
of the coolest and weirdest open mic
performances i've ever heard and also
let's not forget extra instrumental
touches on the lp here and there such as
the woodwinds on no reason so good
lankers performances and songwriting and
lyricism as well that i have to mention
are such an anchor throughout this lp of
course her talents have already been
proven her character has already been
proven on previous big thief records
especially her solo stuff but on this lp
especially i would say they are elevated
with all the backing instrumentation to
a height that they've never been at
before whether you're talking about some
writing from her that is just unbearably
cute and heartwarming like i want to be
the shoelace that you tie on blue
lightning the poetic portrayals of unity
and oneness at the atomic level on the
song the only place the heart wrenching
calls for love on love love love
simulation swarm features one of the
quickest and stickiest vocal melodies i
think lankers ever pinned plus the way
it unfolds into these longer melodic
strands around the chorus and features
this a warm rush of instrumentation
pictured along with imagery of embracing
it's beautiful plus going into each of
these tracks i never really know what
the the point of inspiration or what the
uh personal or contextual reference
point is going to be so it kind of makes
each track an adventure now of course
with 20 songs on this project there are
going to be a couple cuts that i or you
find a little underwhelming for me
personally it's spots like the opener
which in my opinion is
uncharacteristically bland
instrumentally and even lyrically to a
degree given the quality of all the
other tracks on the record even though i
think big thief wanted to let fans and

in a way i kind of prefer that they
would have just let it rip from the jump
the track little things offers a lot of

colorful hazy
layers instrumentally but a strong
melody and song i don't think really
shines through all the clutter and there
are a lot of things i like about the
wintry title track on this lp uh there
are some spots where vocally lenker
reminds me a bit of a stevie nicks even

and generally i think the songwriting

that i'm
sitting here in the middle of a weird

portrayed on the cover i just love it i

emotional potency and just a lot of

the best that indie folk has to offer

what makes it so fun and beautiful and

because it just kind of

uh emotional rollercoaster of a little

it's not even like you need to like

each of these tracks i think can be uh
